profileText: A Delegate from New Jersey; born in New York City, February 5, 1721; attended the public schools; engaged in overseas commerce and also in agricultural pursuits; moved to Bergen County, N.J.; appointed judge of the court of common pleas on September 30, 1766, and served until October 1, 1774; member of the Provincial Congress which met in Trenton in May, June, and August 1775; chairman of the committee of safety of Bergen County, N.J.; member of the provincial council in 1776; captured by the British and held as a political prisoner from April 23, 1777, until January 1778, when he was released; Member of the Continental Congress 1778-1780; member of the State council in 1782 and 1783; moved to New York City in 1793, and subsequently to Coldenham, N.Y., where he resided with his son John until his death on May 15, 1798; interment in Colden Cemetery.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Fell, John. Delegate from New Jersey; The Journal of John Fell. Edited by Donald W. Whisenhunt. Port Washington, N.Y.: Kennikat Press, 1973.

researchRecord.name: 1778-1779, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A diary of John Fell covering the period from November 1778 through November 1779.

researchRecord.name: 1779-1780, 3 folders.
researchRecord.description: A journal of the proceedings of the U.S. Continental Congress in Philadelphia kept by John Fell, delegate from New Jersey, from December 1, 1779 through November 30, 1780.

researchRecord.name: ca. 1797, 3 pages.
researchRecord.description: A letter from John Fell to Richard Sharp. The letter includes a biographical sketch of John Fell, and a typed transcript of the letter enclosed in a folder.

researchRecord.name: 1778, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: "Memorandum in the Provost Jail, N.Y.... by John Fell, one of Council of N. Jersey." The memorandum contains a chronology of events at the jail from 1777 until 1778, a list of prisoners, and other notes.
